-ServerPath.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_ServerPath$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-StatusOnRequestError.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_StatusOnRequestError$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Username.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_Username$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse'

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ServerUri.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_ServerUri$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-QueryParameter.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHttpJsonResponse_String_QueryParameter$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

16.description:
Status to set when the webservice cannot be reached or an error (e.g. 500) is returned - default is Unknown
See https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/plugins/doc/10-Icinga-Plugins/ for description of threshold values
16.caption: StatusOnRequestError

7.description: Query parameter for the request without ?, example "command=example"
7.caption: QueryParameter

5.description: Base URI of the server, example "https://example.comm"
5.caption: ServerUri

18.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
18.caption: Verbosity

12.description: Value types of each parameter. Supported Types: Numeric, Boolean, DateTime, String Example: "myAlias01:Numeric","myAlias02:DateTime"
12.caption: ValueTypes

10.description: Timeout in seconds before the http request is aborted. Defaults to 30
10.caption: Timeout

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description: Credentials to use for basic auth
8.caption: Username

17.description: Negate the conditions set for string parameters. When this is set to true, WarnIfLike/CritIfLike is used instead of WarnIfNotLike/CritIfNotLike for Strings
17.caption: NegateStringResults

11.description: paths to look for values in the JSON object that is checked, including an alias for each parameter. Example: "myAlias01:value01","myAlias02:nested.object.value02", "myAlias03:'object'.'my.Par.With.Dots'"
11.caption: ValuePaths

9.description: Credentials to use for basic auth
9.caption: Password

14.description: Critical thresholds using icinga-powershell syntax. Example: "myNumericAlias01:~:2","myDateTimeAlias:-10d", "myBooleanAlias:True"
14.caption: Critical

15.description: Disables SSL verification and allows the connection to endpoints with self-signed certificates as example
15.caption: IgnoreSSL

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

13.description: Warning thresholds using icinga-powershell syntax. Example: "myNumericAlias01:~:2","myDateTimeAlias:-10d", "myBooleanAlias:True"
13.caption: Warning
